metadata.title: CVE-2023-5345 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's fs/smb/clientcomponent can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. In caseof an error in smb3_fs_context_parse_param, ctx->password was freed but thefield was not set to NULL which could lead to double free. We recommendupgrading past commit e6e43b8aa7cd3c3af686caf0c2e11819a886d705.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5345` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
